intro: Senecio ambiguus subsp. nebrodensis, commonly known as the Nebrodensis Groundsel, is a perennial herb native to the high elevations of the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features narrow, silvery-green leaves and produces yellow flowers in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
